We’re using these cameras from Arducam, does anyone know where I can get a housing for cameras like this? My Google-fu hasn’t returned much.

Arducam

120fps Global Shutter Color USB Camera Board, 1MP OV9782 UVC Webcam with Low...

Buy Now

Est. reading time: 2 minutes

You could do something like this from team 3206. Alternatively, several open alliance teams have build threads with linked CAD where they had Arducam housings and mounts.

Assuming you have a 3D printer, you could look at the cases on yeggi or Thingiverse and print one of those. Plenty of options depending on what you want the housing to do.

I copied the 3206 one and added a few features here: Coprocessor - Google Drive

There’s a link to my Onshape doc in one of the docs.

We designed a 3D printed case that integrates the Orange Pi 5, cooling fan, and camera, all into one package, similar to the limelight. We haven’t fielded it on a robot yet, but we should have the opportunity to give it a real shakedown at an offseason event in the next few weeks. It’s a great project to assigned to a newer CAD member, and I recommend taking a pass at it, but we’ll post ours soon .

We also recently killed an Arducam cable, but couldn’t find any replacements online. How did you replace the cables you killed?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-12-13T02:18:34.961Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":346,"readers_count":345,"score":94.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":441822,"topic_slug":"housing-for-arducam-global-shutter-camera","display_username":"Pooshan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":21715,"username":"asid61","name":"Anand Rajamani","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61481,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"422 CTO"},"post_url":"/t/housing-for-arducam-global-shutter-camera/441822/12","custom_user_title":"422 CTO","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3264112,"name":"Technologyman00","username":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-13T02:31:12.938Z","cooked":"

Its a JST to USB cable. You can crimp a new connector on a different USB cable. I dont know what kind of JST unfortunately. I would guess PH or XT

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2023-12-13T02:38:09.519Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":329,"readers_count":328,"score":110.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":441822,"topic_slug":"housing-for-arducam-global-shutter-camera","display_username":"Technologyman00","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61481,"username":"poosh","name":"Pooshan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5daacb/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25951,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7900, 1792, 1714"},"post_url":"/t/housing-for-arducam-global-shutter-camera/441822/13","custom_user_title":"7900, 1792, 1714","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3264214,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-13T07:17:30.824Z","cooked":"

We contacted Arducam and Uctronics (?) their distributor and they were able to get us cables for a few bucks each. Would not recommend trying to crimp them yourself.

Technologyman00:

I would guess PH or XT

It’s unfortunately smaller than either of these for the Arducam ones, and you need to crimp 5 wires to do this. Probably ZH. Definitely would just get another cable or desolder the header on the board and solder the USB leads directly.
